text: Nina Aleksandrovna Gruzintseva (; 7 April 1934 – 17 October 2021) was a Russian Soviet sprint canoer and referee. She competed at the 1964 Summer Olympics, coming in 5th place. She won the Canoe Sprint European Championships in 1957 and 1961. She also won the ICF Canoe Sprint World Championships in 1958. Gruzintseva was born in Leningrad, Soviet Union. Gruzintseva died on 17 October 2021 in Moscow at the age of 87.Известная советская спортсменка Грузинцева умерла в Великом Новгороде ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Referees Category:Olympians for the Soviet Union
title: Nina Gruzintseva
